Yes, here are some tips to improve focus during meditation practice:

1. Begin with a few deep breaths: Start your meditation with a few deep breaths to calm and center yourself. Focusing on your breath can help you quiet your mind and improve your mental focus.

2. Use guided meditations: Guided meditations can be helpful for beginners because they provide a structure to follow and take the focus off of your thoughts. You can find guided meditations online or through various meditation apps.

3. Start with shorter sessions: If you find it difficult to sit still for a long period of time, start with shorter meditation sessions and gradually increase your practice as you build your focus.

4. Choose a quiet space: Find a quiet space where you can meditate without distraction. Turn off your phone, computer, and any other devices that may distract you.

5. Try different time of the day: Experiment with different times of day to meditate to find a time when you are most focused and alert.

6. Accept and let go of your thoughts: It's normal for your mind to wander during meditation practice. When you notice your thoughts drifting, acknowledge them, but do not engage with them. Just let them go and return your focus to your breath or your chosen visualization.

7. Be patient and consistent: Meditation is a practice that requires patience and consistency. The more you practice, the easier it will become to quiet your mind and improve your focus. Don't give up! The benefits of meditation are plentiful and can be life-changing when practiced regularly.
